Around an hour and a half ago, three Russian Tu-95MS strategic bombers were redeployed from Olenya Airbase, Murmansk Oblast, to Engels-2 Airbase, Saratov Oblast.
These bombers were previously redeployed to Olenya Airbase from Ukrainka Airbase, Amur Oblast. They are likely already equipped with Kh-101 cruise missiles and may carry out combat sorties from Engels-2 Airbase during the next large-scale, combined missile attack on Ukraine, rather than from Olenya.

Overnight, a large-scale Geran-2 drone attack was carried out on the village of Starokozache, Odesa Oblast.   At least 25 drones attacked in three large groups, striking the Starokozache Solar Park and 110 kV electrical substation. Large fires broke out as‚Ä¶
Consequences of the Russian Geran-2 drone strikes on the Starokozache Solar Park and 110 kV electrical substation in Odesa Oblast.
Consequences of the Russian Geran-2 drone strikes on the Starokozache Solar Park and 110 kV electrical substation in Odesa Oblast.

Additionally, during the attacks on Dnipropetrovsk Oblast, one Iskander-M ballistic missile launched from the vicinity of Yeysk, Krasnodar Krai, impacted the town of Mykolaivka. A strong explosion was reported and heard from neighbouring cities.
Last night's Iskander-M ballistic missile strike on Mykolaivka, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast, targeted a Ukrainian Neptune cruise missile launcher.
The last defense line of Ukrainian Army east of Huliaipole is broken.
A short time ago, an Israeli airstrike targeted the eastern suburbs of Gaza City.
Iskander launch from Bryansk Oblast
Iskander launch from Bryansk Oblast
This is Russian S-300/400 air defence working on Ukrainian UAVs.
A short time ago, Russian KAB glide-bombs struck the Voda Donbasu 110 kV electrical substation west of the city of Mykolaivka, Donetsk Oblast. Partial power outages are reported in Slovyansk.
This is Russian S-300/400 air defence working on Ukrainian UAVs.
Possible Ukrainian Neptune cruise missile flying from Karachev, Bryansk Oblast, in the direction of Kaluga.

Multiple Ukrainian drones have impacted the Chaykino 330 kV electrical substation in Donetsk City. The entirety of Donetsk City and Horlivka are without power, and additional widespread outages are reported in the cities of Yenakiieve, Yasynuvata, Makiivka, and other areas. 
Mobile internet outages are also reported in Donetsk City, and additionally, for unknown reasons, an emergency shutdown has been introduced at the Starobesheve Thermal Power Plant.

Multiple Ukrainian drones have impacted the Chaykino 330 kV electrical substation in Donetsk City. The entirety of Donetsk City and Horlivka are without power, and additional widespread outages are reported in the cities of Yenakiieve, Yasynuvata, Makiivka, and other areas. 
Mobile internet outages are also reported in Donetsk City, and additionally, for unknown reasons, an emergency shutdown has been introduced at the Starobesheve Thermal Power Plant.

Multiple Ukrainian drones have impacted the Chaykino 330 kV electrical substation in Donetsk City. The entirety of Donetsk City and Horlivka are without power, and additional widespread outages are reported in the cities of Yenakiieve, Yasynuvata, Makiivka‚Ä¶
Power has begun to return in Horlivka and Makiivka.
Mud season in Kupyansk.

Around an hour and a half ago, three Russian Tu-95MS strategic bombers were redeployed from Olenya Airbase, Murmansk Oblast, to Engels-2 Airbase, Saratov Oblast.  These bombers were previously redeployed to Olenya Airbase from Ukrainka Airbase, Amur Oblast.‚Ä¶

There is an increased threat of a large-scale, combined Russian missile and drone strike involving strategic bombers from Tuesday night/Wednesday morning onwards. 
The 3 Tu-95MS I mentioned earlier ended up flying to Engels-2 Airbase, Saratov Oblast, to be equipped with Kh-101 cruise missiles, before returning to Olenya Airbase, Murmansk Oblast. Currently, there are 4 bombers stationed at Olenya - it is unclear if the 4th is equipped with missiles or not.
Additional flights of Tu-95MS from Ukrainka Airbase, Amur Oblast, to Olenya Airbase will likely take place in the near future, along with redeployments of Tu-160s to Engels-2 Airbase, in preparation for the upcoming attack. Currently, only training of 1 Tu-160 and 1 Tu-95MS has taken place from Ukrainka and is expected to continue tonight on the usual training frequencies. 
2 other Tu-95MS are stationed at Engels-2 Airbase. They are not yet equipped with missiles, as only 1 An-12 cargo plane has arrived at the airbase recently. This was used to equip the 3 bombers from Olenya, along with missiles already stored at Engels-2 from earlier deliveries. 
A number of Iskander-M ballistic missiles have been delivered OTRK installations in Taganrog, Rostov Oblast, as well as northeast of Simferopol, Crimea. Iskander deliveries have likely also taken place to other areas too. 
Accumulation of Geran-2 drones continues, with more than 350 drones stored at launch sites surrounding Ukraine for the upcoming attack. This number is likely to increase further over the next few days.
Some of the destruction in the city of Kostyantynivka as a result of extensive Russian FAB, artillery, MLRS, and drone strikes.
Some of the destruction in the city of Kostyantynivka as a result of extensive Russian FAB, artillery, MLRS, and drone strikes.

Strike Overview: Over 150 Missiles and 2,000 Drones Have Targeted Ukraine's Energy System Since Early October
Russia and Ukraine exchanged strikes on the night of November 16. According to a statement by the Russian Ministry of Defense, Russian air defense systems destroyed 57 Ukrainian unmanned aerial vehicles over several regions. Meanwhile, data from the Ukrainian Air Force indicate that Russian forces employed one ballistic missile and 176 attack drones, of which 139 were shot down or suppressed.
According to information from Ukrenergo, Russia launched more than 150 missiles and over 2,000 drones at Ukraine's energy infrastructure in October and early November alone. The targets include facilities for electricity generation, transmission, and distribution, as well as gas infrastructure. Experts offer pessimistic forecasts, citing the current shortage of generating capacity, constant damage, and limited resource reserves. As a result, the electricity deficit...

Military Situation In Syria On November 16, 2025 (Map Update)

Russian Offensive On The Zaporizhzhia Axis: Gains Near Huliaipole And Orikhiv Reshape The Front
In recent weeks, the Russian offensive on the Zaporizhzhia axis has been marked by significant advances and the seizure of key population centers, substantially altering the tactical and strategic picture in the region. One important success for the Russian army has been establishing 
control over the village of Rivnopillia
, located in the Huliaipole sector, just a kilometer north of the previously captured Yablokove. This allows Russian units to advance closer to the district center of Huliaipole, from which Rivnopillia is now separated by only one settlement‚ÄîZatyshshia.
The advance of Russian forces from Rivnopillia toward Varvarivka is particularly important for severing the supply routes to the Ukrainian garrison in Huliaipole. The area is traversed by the P-85 highway, a key logistics artery from the northern regions. 
üëâ

Military Situation In Ukraine On November 16, 2025 (Maps Update)
Military Situation In Ukraine On November 16, 2025 (Maps Update)

Ukraine's Deserter Numbers Near The Size Of Its Active-Duty Army
A troubling trend continues in Ukraine, marked by mass unauthorized abandonment of military units and desertion. According to Roman Kostenko, Secretary of the Verkhovna Rada Committee on National Security, the number of soldiers who have gone AWOL is approaching the total strength of the entire Ukrainian army.
He notes that approximately 80% of mobilized individuals "simply flee from training centers," and the country is not taking effective measures to return these servicemen or to create conditions that would compel them to fulfill their duty. Millions of draft evaders are in hiding, observing from the sidelines, unwilling to participate in the conflict. Furthermore, the number of individuals mobilized in October was approximately 26,500, of whom 21,000 deserted, resulting in a net reinforcement of only about 5,000 personnel. This comes as monthly casualties (killed and wounded) are estimated at 20,000-25,000 servicemen...
üëâ

A troubling trend continues in Ukraine, marked by mass unauthorized abandonment of military units and desertion. According to Roman Kostenko, Secretary of the Verkhovna Rada Committee on National Security, the number of soldiers who have gone AWOL is approaching the total strength of the entire Ukrainian army.

This comes as monthly casualties (killed and wounded) are estimated at 20,000-25,000 servicemen...

Siversk In A Vise: Russian Forces Tighten The Encirclement Of Ukrainian Garrison
Russian units are poised to sever the R-85 highway, a critical supply route for Ukrainian forces in Huliaipole. The encirclement of Ukrainian troops in Siversk is steadily tightening. Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orb√°n has stated that the conflict in Ukraine could end in the near future.
Siversk Sector: 
The Ukrainian Armed Forces in Siversk are gradually losing control of their area, with their main logistical routes under fire from Russian units. Fierce fighting continues in Yampol in the northern sector. Unmanned aerial vehicles are being used extensively to contain the offensive. Attempts to transfer equipment and personnel are being thwarted, with most of the equipment destroyed en route to the settlement. In the Dronovka area, the advance is taking place along the railway line towards Siversk, where there is also high UAV activity.
üëâ
